title: Entities and Resolution

version_changes.summary: Significant growth in module organization and imports. use statements increased 88% (2874->5399), crate:: paths increased 46% (3525->5145), pub(crate) increased 45% (671->974), pub(super) dramatically increased (49->248).
key_changes: pub use re-exports increased from 232 to 434 (+87%)
pub mod declarations increased significantly (670 instances)

summary: FLS Chapter 14 defines entities, visibility, paths, scopes, namespaces, preludes, use imports, shadowing, and resolution. iceoryx2 v0.8.0 demonstrates comprehensive use of these concepts with expanded module organization due to the restructured crate layout and new FFI layer.

14.1:1_to_14.1:3.rule: An entity is a construct that can be referred to. A name is an identifier that refers to an entity. A declaration introduces a name for an entity.

14.1:4_to_14.1:21.rule: Explicitly declared entities include: associated items, bindings, constants, declarative macros, enum types, enum variants, fields, functions, generic parameters, implementations, labels, modules, statics, struct types, traits, type aliases, union types.

14.2:1.rule: Visibility is a property of fields and items that determines which modules can refer to the name.

14.2:2_14.2:10.rule: Public visibility allows name reference from arbitrary modules; simple public modifier (pub) grants public visibility.

14.2:5.rule: Crate public modifier pub(crate) grants public visibility within current crate only.

14.2:11.rule: Super public modifier pub(super) grants public visibility within parent module only.

14.3:1_to_14.3:3.rule: A path is a sequence of path segments separated by :: that resolves to an entity.

crate_paths.description: Paths starting with crate:: for absolute references within current crate

super_paths.description: Paths using super:: to reference parent module

self_paths.description: Paths using self:: for current module references

core_paths.description: Paths using ::core:: for core library references

14.7:1.rule: A use import brings entities in scope within the block expression or module.

re_exports.description: pub use statements for re-exporting items

module_organization.notes: Significant module restructuring in v0.8.0 with flattened crate hierarchy

visibility_layering.description: Strategic use of visibility modifiers for API design
visibility_layering.pattern: pub for API, pub(crate) for internal, pub(super) for submodule sharing, private for implementation

module_organization.description: Hierarchical module structure with clear visibility boundaries

re_export_patterns.description: Re-exporting types from dependencies for API convenience

cross_chapter_references.chapter_4: Types and Traits - type namespace entities
cross_chapter_references.chapter_6: Expressions - path expressions, method calls, field access
cross_chapter_references.chapter_11: Implementations - inherent and trait implementation resolution
cross_chapter_references.chapter_13: Attributes - attribute resolution in macro namespace
cross_chapter_references.chapter_20: Macros - macro namespace and textual macro scope
